content:
Privacy Policy

WhatTime Company, Inc. 

Last Updated: 16th November 2020

Our Privacy Policy aims to provide you assurances that we take your privacy seriously. 

Our goal is to be clear and transparent in our policies and practices regarding the collection and use of your personal information, as well as making you aware of the options you have concerning the collection and use of your information. 

This policy covers the use of your data for interest-based advertising when you are using the free version of our Apps (if you pay for our Apps, we will not conduct any interest-based advertising). For more information about this topic, please click here to jump directly to the relevant section of this privacy policy.

As a participant of the Digital Advertising Alliance (ADD), we adhere to DAA’s interest-based advertising principles by providing you enhanced notice, transparency and control of our digital marketing practices as stated at http://www.aboutads.info/principles.

You can read our Privacy Policy in full, below. First, here's an overview of the key points. 

Policy Overview

What do we use your information for?

We use your Personal Information with the sole purpose of delivering you the best possible experience of our Services. Accordingly, we use your information to:

Provide and administer the Services. Monitor bugs, crashes and other service-related issues to maintain delivery of our Services to you. Analyze trends, usage and activities, so we might improve our Services. Send you updates and other service-related communications. 

We collect mobile identifiers such as Android’s Advertising ID (AAID/IFA) or Apple’s Identifier for Advertising and cookies to conduct interest-based advertising, also referred to as targeted advertising or behavioral advertising. Click here to learn more about interest-based advertising.

We do not conduct any interest-based advertising on the paid versions of our Apps.

We do not conduct any interest-based advertising on the app titled Whattime. The only advertising which takes place on this app is done by ourselves, for ourselves!

How do we collect your information?

Direct from you, through your engagement with the Services (for example, when you create an account or connect to the Services through a third-party sign in), questionnaires, surveys and other communications with us. From your Device in the form of Cookies, Log Data and Web Beacons (for the purposes of delivering content requests, optimizing the Services for your particular device and gathering information to improve the Services). 

What personal information do we collect?

When you use our Services, you may voluntarily provide us with Personal Information through the following means:

Contact information (such as your name, phone number, postal address or email address). Account/registration information (such as username and password, age, gender and email address). Information gathered through your participation in feedback questionnaires, surveys, reviews and Whattime run competitions. Publicly available information (such as forums, community areas and blogs). 

As is common practice, we also gather certain information that is automatically transmitted through your Device, as detailed below:

Log information, such as your Device Internet Protocol ("IP") address, device name, operating system version, the configuration of the App when utilizing our Services, broad non-specific geographical location, the time and date of your use of our Services and other statistical data. Service activity information (such as account and user settings). 

We do not collect, store or process credit or debit card data. Apple or Google collect all payment data and information with respect to purchases made through the App or via Apple's App Store or Google’s Play Store. 

Who might we share your information with?

Service providers contracted by us to assist in the provision, maintenance or improvement of our Services. A purchaser of our business. Other third parties, only with your permission. The appropriate authorities, should we be required to by law. 

Let us know what you'd like us to do with your information

You have the right to:

Access the Personal Information we hold. Ask that your Personal Information be corrected, updated, or deleted. Opt-out of the use of your Personal Information for marketing purposes. 

If you would like to exercise any of these rights or have any other thoughts on how you'd like us to use your Personal Information please contact us at contact@whattime.co.kr

More information

If you have any questions or require any further information in relation to our Privacy Policy please contact us at contact@whattime.co.kr. 

Full Privacy Policy

1. Definitions

The terms Whattime, us, we or our refers to Good Good Company, Inc. . 

The terms you, your or yourself refer to the user of the Services. 

The term Services refers to all services provided by Good Good Company, Inc. and our mobile device application (App). 

The term Device refers to the device which is used to access the Services including but not limited to computers, smart phones, tablets, headphones, wearable smart devices, and speakers. 

The term Content refers to any and all Whattime and third-party editorial content, information, text, images, photos, videos, artwork, illustrations, graphic (art and electronic) images, audio, music, sounds, postings, messages, recommendations, comments, software, files, feedback, bug reports, or other protected materials and authored works of any kind that are utilized in the provision of the Services. 

The term Personal Information refers to any information relating to an identified or identifiable person. In the context of this Privacy Policy, this refers specifically to yourself. 

2. General

Your privacy is very important to us. We are committed to protecting and respecting your privacy in the way we collect and use your Personal Information. 

This policy describes how your Personal Information is collected and used when you access or use our Services, including when you contact our team, engage with us on social media, or otherwise interact with us. This Privacy Policy does not apply to any third-party websites, services or applications, even if accessible through our Services. 

Our Privacy Policy is incorporated by reference in our Terms & Conditions (Terms), you are advised to make sure you have read, understand and agree to our Terms before accessing and using our Services. 

Please note that if you choose to use or access our Services, whether on a free or Membership basis, you acknowledge and agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this Privacy Policy. If you do not agree to any component of the Privacy Policy, you must stop using the Services immediately. 

Should you have any questions in relation to our Privacy Policy, please contact us at contact@whattime.co.kr. 

3. What do we use your information for?

We use your Personal Information with the sole purpose of delivering you the best possible experience of our Services. Accordingly, we use your information to:

Provide and administer your use of our Services, to ensure that the Services are presented in the most effective manner for you and for your Device, to enable you to enjoy and easily navigate the Services. Detect and monitor bugs, crashes and other service-related issues to maintain delivery of our Services to you. Analyze trends, usage and activities, so we might improve our Services. Sending you transactional or service communications, such as receipts, account and update notifications, customer service responses, and other administrative communications. 

We do not sell or share your Personal Information onto third parties for behavior targeted advertising or for any other marketing purposes. 

4. How do we collect your information?

4. 1. Information collected from you

When you use our Services, you may voluntarily provide us with Personal Information through the following means:

By setting up and registering an account. Through your communication with our team, including but not limited to technical and customer support communications. Through your participation in questionnaires, online surveys, reviews or feedback questions. Through your participation in Whattime run competitions. Through information you submit on Whattime's public platforms which may include but are not limited to forums, community areas, social media sites and blogs. 

Please note, any information you provide to us by way of suggestions, ideas, and improvements are subject to the provisions of this Policy. 

4. 2. Information collected from your Device

As is common practice for most websites and mobile applications, we gather certain information that is automatically transmitted through your Device, as detailed below:

In some cases, we may collect and store information about your approximate location, by converting your IP address into a rough, non-specific, proxy location, e. g. town/city level. We may use such anonymized information for operational and improvement analytics. Information that is sent by your Device when you use our Services, such as device identifier, user settings, mobile carrier, and the operating system of your Device. This information allows us to securely enable you to access your account, to ensure that the Services are presented in the most effective manner for you on your Device, to enable you to enjoy and easily navigate the Services and to enable us to gather anonymized usage data to understand how we can improve the Services. Whenever you use our Services, in a case of an error, bug or crash in the Services we collect data and information (through third party products) on your Device called Log Data. Log Data may include information such as your Device Internet Protocol ("IP") address, device name, operating system version, the configuration of the App when utilizing our Service, the time and date of your use of the Services, and other statistics. Cookies are files with a small amount of data that are commonly used as anonymous unique identifiers. These are sent to your browser from the websites that you visit and are stored on your Device's internal memory. Whattime does not use these "cookies" explicitly. However, Whattime may use third party code and libraries that use "cookies" to collect information and improve the performance of the Services. Your Device may contain settings that allow you to refuse cookies. If you choose to refuse cookies or disengage similar features on your Device, some or all of the Services may not be optimized for your use and you may not be able to access the full functionality of the Services. Web beacons, tags and pixels are electronic files used to collect non-personal anonymized information about usage of the Services for product improvement and development purposes. 

6. What personal information do we collect?

Contact information (such as your name, phone number, postal address or email address). Account/registration information (such as username and password, age, gender and email address). Information gathered through your participation in feedback questionnaires, surveys, reviews and Whattime run competitions. Broad, non-specific geographical location information. Log information, such as your Device Internet Protocol ("IP") address, device name, operating system version, the configuration of the App when utilizing our Services, the time and date of your use of our Services and other statistical data. Service activity information (such as account and user settings). Publicly available information (such as forums, community areas and blogs). 

We do not collect, store or process credit or debit card data. Apple collect all payment data and information with respect to purchases made through the App or via Apple's App Store. 

7. Security

We value your trust in providing us your Personal Information, and so we strive to take all commercially acceptable means of protecting it through strict procedures and security features upon receipt of your information. 

While we make every effort to ensure the integrity and security of our network and systems, we cannot guarantee that our security measures will prevent third-party "hackers" from illegally obtaining this information. As a further disclaimer, no method of transmission over the internet, or method of electronic storage is completely secure and reliable, and so whilst we do our best to protect your information we cannot guarantee its absolute security. Accordingly, we cannot accept liability for unintentional disclosure. 

8. Who might we share your personal information with?

We will not process, use or share your information with anyone, except as detailed below. 

8. 1. Service providers

Whattime may employ or contract third-party service providers for the following reasons:

Facilitating or administering our Services. Monitoring our servers for technical issues. Maintaining or improving our Services. Providing the Services on our behalf. Assisting in analyzing how our Services are used. 

These service providers may have access to your Personal Information in the performance of the tasks assigned to them on our behalf. These third parties' access and use of your Personal Information will be governed by the terms of this Privacy Policy and they will be prohibited from using or sharing your Personal Information except as necessary to perform the contracted services on our behalf, or to comply with legal requirements. 

We currently use Google Analytics and Google Analytics for Firebase as a service provider for app and website analytics. These services have been engaged to report on activities and trends in the use of our Services for product development and improvement purposes only. 

You can read more about how Google Analytics uses your Personal Information here: https://www. google. com/intl/en/policies/privacy/

Please note we may also share non-personal information (aggregated or anonymized user data) publicly and with service providers for research or marketing purposes, for example, we may share trends in use of the Services and Content. 

8. 2. Change of control

Upon the sale or transfer of the company and/or all or part of its assets, your Personal Information may be transferred to a subsequent owner or co-owner of the business. 

We will request the purchaser to access and use your Personal Information in accordance with this Privacy Policy. 

8. 3. Other third parties, only with your permission

We may share Personal Information when we have your permission, for instance if you sign up for programs offered by us or any of our partners. If you do this, we may share certain information with these partners. This could include your account information and the activation status of your Device. 

If you use third-party services integrated with our Services, the terms and privacy policies of these third parties will govern those services, we therefore advise you to review these before using the services. 

The Services, App or Site may also contain links to other sites or apps. If you click on a third-party link, you will be directed to their site or app. Note that these external sites are not operated by us. Therefore, we strongly advise you to review the privacy policy of these websites. We have no control over and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third-party sites or services. 

We do collect behavioral information about you when you are using the free versions of our Apps or some of our websites. This behavioral information is shared with third-party partners to conduct interest-based advertising.

We share your personal data with third parties to measure our performance and increase our conversion rates, such as Facebook Analytics and Clevertap. These third parties provide us with analytics for our websites and Apps, which can then be used to segment users based on demographic information, custom events and user or session activity as part of our interest-based advertising activities.

We do not use the information collected via HealthKit for advertising purposes nor are we selling the data collected to any advertising platforms, data brokers or information resellers

Interest-based advertising is also referred to as targeted advertising or behavioral advertising.

Simply put, we collect personal information about you which we or our partners use to provide you with ads which are relevant to you.

Here’s an example. We collect data about your behavior on our free Apps – such as how long you spend watching, and how often. It’s important to understand that this behavior is linked to an anonymous cookie ID, and not to directly identifying information such as your name, address or credit card number.

The behavior linked to the anonymous cookie ID can then be used for retargeting or advertising. For instance, we could target all users who are watching frequently with a specific promotion based on their usage. We can also use this behavior linked to the anonymous cookie ID as part of real-time bidding (RTB).

Real-time bidding is a type of automated buying of advertising placements.If a third party decides to buy the data associated with the anonymous cookie ID, it is then provided with data such as an encrypted email or mobile advertising identifiers which is used to serve you with the relevant ads – such as comfortable pillows for a better sleep!

You can also visit the Digital Advertising Alliance of Canada for more information on the tools available to you to control your participation in interest-based advertising.

We conduct interest-based advertising on the free versions of our Apps. This allows us to deliver these services without cost to you. Otherwise, you can use the paid versions of our Apps – we will not use your data for interest-based advertising if you pay for our services. We also conduct interest-based advertising through some of our websites.

We use third parties such ad exchanges to deliver interest-based advertising

Through our free mobile Apps, we conduct real-time bidding to automate the buying of advertising placements. In order to effectively sell our advertising placements. These third parties have access to mobile advertising identifiers which are then used to serve the ads.

Mobile users can also download the DAA Choice App at Apple App Store or Google Play Store to manage your consent to interest-based advertising in our free Apps.

If you want to opt-out from Facebook Custom Audience Tool and Conversion Tracking Pixels, you can do so by clicking here. If you opt out, we will remove you from all our custom audiences.

You can also opt-out of interest-based advertising occurring on our websites and web applications by visiting www.aboutads.info/choices or managing your cookie preferences. Click here to jump to the relevant section of this privacy policy on managing cookie preferences.

8. 4. Compliance with legal obligations

We may provide information to a third party if we are required to do so by law or we believe in good faith that such action is necessary. For example, to respond to legal process, or comply with applicable laws, including lawful requests by public authorities to meet national security or law enforcement requirements. 

9. How you can manage your personal information

You have the right to:

Access the Personal Information we hold. Ask that your Personal Information be corrected, updated, or deleted. Opt-out of the use of your Personal Information for marketing purposes. 

If you would like to exercise any of these rights or have any other thoughts on how you would like us to use your Personal Information please contact us at contact@whattime.co.kr. 

10. Changes to this policy

We reserve the right to change and update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any updates or changes by posting the updated Privacy Policy on our Site, updating the "Last Updated" date to indicate when the changes are effective. We may provide you additional notice by email or by a notification through the App, on the Site and/or by asking you to review the changes to the updated Privacy Policy the next time you access the Services. We encourage you to periodically review this Privacy Policy to maintain currency with our position on privacy matters. 

You are advised to read the updated Privacy Policy carefully. By continuing to use our Services after the date the changes are effective you will be deemed to have accepted the updated Privacy Policy. If you do not agree to any component of the Privacy Policy, you must stop using the Services immediately.

8. 4. Compliance with legal obligations
We may provide information to a third party if we are required to do so by law or we believe in good faith that such action is necessary. For example, to respond to legal process, or comply with applicable laws, including lawful requests by public authorities to meet national security or law enforcement requirements. 
9. How you can manage your personal information
You have the right to:
Access the Personal Information we hold. Ask that your Personal Information be corrected, updated, or deleted. Opt-out of the use of your Personal Information for marketing purposes. 
If you would like to exercise any of these rights or have any other thoughts on how you would like us to use your Personal Information please contact us at contact@whattime.co.kr. 
10. Changes to this policy
We reserve the right to change and update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any updates or changes by posting the updated Privacy Policy on our Site, updating the "Last Updated" date to indicate when the changes are effective. We may provide you additional notice by email or by a notification through the App, on the Site and/or by asking you to review the changes to the updated Privacy Policy the next time you access the Services. We encourage you to periodically review this Privacy Policy to maintain currency with our position on privacy matters. 
You are advised to read the updated Privacy Policy carefully. By continuing to use our Services after the date the changes are effective you will be deemed to have accepted the updated Privacy Policy. If you do not agree to any component of the Privacy Policy, you must stop using the Services immediately.
